Bash(/c/Users/Work/miniconda3/python.exe -c "
from PIL import Image
import os

# Create responsive versions of hero images
hero_images = [
    ''powerflexMDBlayoutimage.webp'',
    ''powerflexMDBlayoutimage2.webp'', 
    ''powerflexMDBlayoutimage3.webp''
]

# Responsive sizes to create
sizes = [
    {''suffix'': ''-400'', ''width'': 400, ''height'': 267},  # Mobile (3:2 aspect ratio)
    {''suffix'': ''-600'', ''width'': 600, ''height'': 400},  # Tablet  
    {''suffix'': ''-800'', ''width'': 800, ''height'': 533}   # Desktop
]

total_saved = 0
created_files = []

for img_name in hero_images:
    input_path = f''public/images/{img_name}''
    base_name = img_name.replace(''.webp'', '''')
    
    if os.path.exists(input_path):
        original_size = os.path.getsize(input_path)
        print(f''Processing {img_name} (Original: {original_size/1024:.1f}KB)'')
        
        with Image.open(input_path) as img:
            print(f''  Original dimensions: {img.size}'')
            
            for size_config in sizes:
                output_path = f''public/images/{base_name}{size_config[""suffix""]}.webp''
                
                # Resize maintaining aspect ratio
                resized = img.resize((size_config[''width''], size_config[''height'']), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)
                
                # Save with good compression
                resized.save(output_path, ''WebP'', quality=75, method=6)
                
                new_size = os.path.getsize(output_path)
                saved = original_size - new_size
                total_saved += saved
                created_files.append(output_path)
                
                print(f''  Created {size_config[""suffix""]}: {size_config[""width""]}x{size_config[""height""]} ({new_size/1024:.1f}KB)'')
        
        print()
    else:
        print(f''Warning: {input_path} not found'')

print(f''Total responsive images created: {len(created_files)}'')
print(f''Estimated total savings: {total_saved/1024:.1f}KB'')
print(''Created files:'')
for file in created_files:
    print(f''  {file}'')
")

from PIL import Image
import os

# Convert the remaining PNG to WebP
png_file = ''public/images/products/6portMDB.png''
webp_file = ''public/images/webp/6portMDB.webp''

if os.path.exists(png_file):
    original_size = os.path.getsize(png_file)
    
    with Image.open(png_file) as img:
        print(f''Converting 6portMDB.png: {img.size}'')
        print(f''Original size: {original_size/1024:.1f}KB'')
        
        # Save as WebP with good compression
        img.save(webp_file, ''WebP'', quality=80, method=6)
        
        new_size = os.path.getsize(webp_file)
        saved = original_size - new_size
        
        print(f''WebP size: {new_size/1024:.1f}KB (Saved: {saved/1024:.1f}KB)'')
        print(f''Compression: {((original_size - new_size) / original_size * 100):.1f}%'')
else:
    print(''6portMDB.png not found, checking if already converted...'')
    if os.path.exists(webp_file):
        print(''Already converted to WebP'')
    else:
        print(''File not found in either location'')
")

Bash(/c/Users/Work/miniconda3/python.exe -c "
from PIL import Image
import os

# Convert the remaining PNG to WebP
png_file = ''public/images/products/6portMDB.png''
webp_file = ''public/images/webp/6portMDB.webp''

if os.path.exists(png_file):
    original_size = os.path.getsize(png_file)
    
    with Image.open(png_file) as img:
        print(f''Converting 6portMDB.png: {img.size}'')
        print(f''Original size: {original_size/1024:.1f}KB'')
        
        # Resize to actual display size (206x157) and save as WebP
        resized = img.resize((206, 157), Image.Resampling.LANCZOS)
        resized.save(webp_file, ''WebP'', quality=80, method=6)
        
        new_size = os.path.getsize(webp_file)
        saved = original_size - new_size
        
        print(f''WebP size: {new_size/1024:.1f}KB (Saved: {saved/1024:.1f}KB)'')
        print(f''Resized and optimized: 230x175 -> 206x157'')
else:
    print(''6portMDB.png not found'')
")

Bash(/c/Users/Work/miniconda3/python.exe -c "
import os
from PIL import Image
import cairosvg

# List of WebP files that the component expects but don''t exist
missing_webp = [
    ''9portMDB'',
    ''MDBtechnicaldrawing'', 
    ''10portSDB'',
    ''SDBtechnicaldrawing'',
    ''3poletee'',
    ''3pteetechnicaldrawing'',
    ''armouredconnection'',
    ''armouredconnectionandextendertechnicaldrawing'',
    ''unarmouredconnectiontechnicaldrawing'',
    ''armouredextender'',
    ''unarmouredextendertechnicaldrawing'',
    ''rcdmodule'',
    ''4gangpowermodeule'',
    ''4gangpowermoduletechnicaldrawing'',
    ''2gangpowerusb'',
    ''blackregulargrommet'',
    ''standardgrommettechnicaldrawing_1'',
    ''largegrommet'',
    ''largegrommettechnicaldrawing''
]

total_converted = 0
total_saved = 0

for filename in missing_webp:
    # Check for SVG first, then PNG
    svg_path = f''public/images/products/{filename}.svg''
    png_path = f''public/images/products/{filename}.png''
    webp_path = f''public/images/webp/{filename}.webp''
    
    source_path = None
    if os.path.exists(svg_path):
        source_path = svg_path
        source_type = ''SVG''
    elif os.path.exists(png_path):
        source_path = png_path
        source_type = ''PNG''
    
    if source_path:
        try:
            if source_type == ''SVG'':
                # Convert SVG to PNG first, then to WebP
                temp_png = f''temp_{filename}.png''
                cairosvg.svg2png(url=source_path, write_to=temp_png)
                
                with Image.open(temp_png) as img:
                    img.save(webp_path, ''WebP'', quality=80, method=6)
                
                os.remove(temp_png)  # Clean up temp file
            else:
                # Direct PNG to WebP conversion
                with Image.open(source_path) as img:
                    img.save(webp_path, ''WebP'', quality=80, method=6)
            
            # Calculate savings
            original_size = os.path.getsize(source_path)
            new_size = os.path.getsize(webp_path)
            saved = original_size - new_size
            total_saved += saved
            total_converted += 1
            
            print(f''Converted {filename}.{source_type.lower()} -> {filename}.webp ({original_size/1024:.1f}KB -> {new_size/1024:.1f}KB, saved {saved/1024:.1f}KB)'')
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f''Error converting {filename}: {e}'')
    else:
        print(f''Warning: {filename} not found in products folder'')

print(f''\nTotal files converted: {total_converted}'')
print(f''Total space saved: {total_saved/1024:.1f}KB'')
")

Bash(/c/Users/Work/miniconda3/python.exe -c "
import os
from PIL import Image
import cairosvg

# List of WebP files to recreate with higher quality
webp_files = [
    ''9portMDB'',
    ''MDBtechnicaldrawing'', 
    ''10portSDB'',
    ''SDBtechnicaldrawing'',
    ''3poletee'',
    ''3pteetechnicaldrawing'',
    ''armouredconnection'',
    ''armouredconnectionandextendertechnicaldrawing'',
    ''unarmouredconnectiontechnicaldrawing'',
    ''armouredextender'',
    ''unarmouredextendertechnicaldrawing'',
    ''rcdmodule'',
    ''4gangpowermodeule'',
    ''4gangpowermoduletechnicaldrawing'',
    ''2gangpowerusb'',
    ''blackregulargrommet'',
    ''standardgrommettechnicaldrawing_1'',
    ''largegrommet'',
    ''largegrommettechnicaldrawing''
]

total_converted = 0

for filename in webp_files:
    # Check for SVG first, then PNG
    svg_path = f''public/images/products/{filename}.svg''
    png_path = f''public/images/products/{filename}.png''
    webp_path = f''public/images/webp/{filename}.webp''
    
    source_path = None
    if os.path.exists(svg_path):
        source_path = svg_path
        source_type = ''SVG''
    elif os.path.exists(png_path):
        source_path = png_path
        source_type = ''PNG''
    
    if source_path:
        try:
            if source_type == ''SVG'':
                # Convert SVG to PNG first, then to WebP with higher quality
                temp_png = f''temp_{filename}.png''
                cairosvg.svg2png(url=source_path, write_to=temp_png)
                
                with Image.open(temp_png) as img:
                    img.save(webp_path, ''WebP'', quality=95, method=6)  # Higher quality
                
                os.remove(temp_png)  # Clean up temp file
            else:
                # Direct PNG to WebP conversion with higher quality
                with Image.open(source_path) as img:
                    img.save(webp_path, ''WebP'', quality=95, method=6)  # Higher quality
            
            total_converted += 1
            new_size = os.path.getsize(webp_path)
            print(f''Recreated {filename}.{source_type.lower()} -> WebP (Quality 95, {new_size/1024:.1f}KB)'')
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f''Error converting {filename}: {e}'')

print(f''Total files recreated with higher quality: {total_converted}'')
")

Bash(/c/Users/Work/miniconda3/python.exe -c "
from PIL import Image
import os

# Convert remaining PNG files to high-quality WebP
remaining_pngs = [
    ''4portSDB'',
    ''6portSDB'', 
    ''unarmouredconnection'',
    ''unarmouredextender'',
    ''2gangpowermodule'',
    ''3gangpowermodule'',
    ''darkgreyregulargrommet''
]

total_converted = 0

for filename in remaining_pngs:
    png_path = f''public/images/products/{filename}.png''
    webp_path = f''public/images/webp/{filename}.webp''
    
    if os.path.exists(png_path):
        with Image.open(png_path) as img:
            # Save with highest quality for crisp small images
            img.save(webp_path, ''WebP'', quality=100, method=6, lossless=False)
            
            original_size = os.path.getsize(png_path)
            new_size = os.path.getsize(webp_path)
            
            print(f''Converted {filename}.png -> WebP (Quality 100, {original_size/1024:.1f}KB -> {new_size/1024:.1f}KB)'')
            total_converted += 1
    else:
        print(f''Missing: {filename}.png'')

print(f''Total PNG files converted to high-quality WebP: {total_converted}'')
")

Bash(/c/Users/Work/miniconda3/python.exe -c "
import os
from PIL import Image
import cairosvg

# List of WebP files to recreate at higher resolution
webp_files = [
    ''9portMDB'',
    ''MDBtechnicaldrawing'', 
    ''10portSDB'',
    ''SDBtechnicaldrawing'',
    ''3poletee'',
    ''3pteetechnicaldrawing'',
    ''armouredconnection'',
    ''armouredconnectionandextendertechnicaldrawing'',
    ''unarmouredconnectiontechnicaldrawing'',
    ''armouredextender'',
    ''unarmouredextendertechnicaldrawing'',
    ''rcdmodule'',
    ''4gangpowermodeule'',
    ''4gangpowermoduletechnicaldrawing'',
    ''2gangpowerusb'',
    ''blackregulargrommet'',
    ''standardgrommettechnicaldrawing_1'',
    ''largegrommet'',
    ''largegrommettechnicaldrawing''
]

total_converted = 0

for filename in webp_files:
    svg_path = f''public/images/products/{filename}.svg''
    png_path = f''public/images/products/{filename}.png''
    webp_path = f''public/images/webp/{filename}.webp''
    
    source_path = None
    if os.path.exists(svg_path):
        source_path = svg_path
        source_type = ''SVG''
    elif os.path.exists(png_path):
        source_path = png_path
        source_type = ''PNG''
    
    if source_path:
        try:
            if source_type == ''SVG'':
                # Convert SVG to large PNG first (2x or 3x size), then to WebP
                temp_png = f''temp_{filename}.png''
                # Render SVG at 3x size (600x600 instead of default ~200x200)
                cairosvg.svg2png(url=source_path, write_to=temp_png, output_width=800, output_height=800)
                
                with Image.open(temp_png) as img:
                    img.save(webp_path, ''WebP'', quality=95, method=6)
                
                os.remove(temp_png)
            else:
                # PNG files - keep original size with high quality
                with Image.open(source_path) as img:
                    img.save(webp_path, ''WebP'', quality=100, method=6, lossless=False)
            
            total_converted += 1
            new_size = os.path.getsize(webp_path)
            print(f''Recreated {filename}.{source_type.lower()} -> WebP (High-res, {new_size/1024:.1f}KB)'')
            
        except Exception as e:
            print(f''Error converting {filename}: {e}'')

print(f''Total files recreated at higher resolution: {total_converted}'')
")
